video:video.video:title: Addressing Cancer Disparities Among American Indian and Alaska Native Populations
video:video.video:description: The three researchers featured in this video receive funding from NCI to conduct research among American Indian and Alaska Native populations

video:video.video:title: Behavioral Research In Cancer Prevention and Control
video:video.video:description: The Behavioral Research Program (BRP) is within the National Cancer Institute’s Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

video:video.video:title: Biobehavioral and Psychological Sciences at NCI: Bridging Visual Perception and Attention
video:video.video:description: Dr. Todd Horowitz, Program Director at the National Cancer Institute (NCI) describes the innovative research he conducts in cancer prevention and how to get involved with his work or similar initiatives at the NCI.

video:video.video:title: Building Bridges to Maximize Functioning
video:video.video:description: Lynne Padgett, Program Director at the National Cancer Institute (NCI) describes the innovative research she is involved with in cancer research and how to get involved with her work or similar initiatives at the NCI.

video:video.video:title: Cancer Epidemiology and Genomics Research â€“ Kathy J. Helzlsouer, M.D., M.H.S.
video:video.video:description: In October 2015, Kathy J. Helzlsouer, M.D., M.H.S., joined NCI’s Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences (DCCPS) as Associate Director for the Epidemiology and Genomics Research Program (EGRP).
